column1: 1            My meaning is to work what wonders love hath wrought
2            Wherewith I muse why men of wit have love so dearly bought;
3            For love is worse than hate
column2: and eke more harm hath done:

column1: 4            Record I take of those that rede of Paris
5            It seemed the God of sleep had mazed so much his wits
6            When he refused wit for love
8            There be of his posterity alive
9            Whom I might well condemn to be a cruel judge

column2: who hath the crime in others that I grudge.
